refnamediv.refpurpose: portable method of determining the limits of the standard types.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis:
#include <glib.h>
#define G_MININT #define G_MAXINT #define G_MAXUINT
#define G_MINSHORT #define G_MAXSHORT #define G_MAXUSHORT
#define G_MINLONG #define G_MAXLONG #define G_MAXULONG
#define G_MININT8 #define G_MAXINT8 #define G_MAXUINT8
#define G_MININT16 #define G_MAXINT16 #define G_MAXUINT16
#define G_MININT32 #define G_MAXINT32 #define G_MAXUINT32
#define G_MININT64 #define G_MAXINT64 #define G_MAXUINT64
#define G_MAXSIZE
#define G_MINFLOAT #define G_MAXFLOAT
#define G_MINDOUBLE #define G_MAXDOUBLE

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: These macros provide a portable method to determine the limits of some of the standard integer and floating point types.

refsect2.title: G_MININT
refsect2.para: The minimum value which can be held in a gint.

refsect2.title: G_MINFLOAT
refsect2.para: The minimum positive value which can be held in a gfloat.
If you are interested in the smallest value which can be held in a gfloat, use -G_MAX_FLOAT.
